title: Building DevCheck — Creating Developer Tools with Electron & React
description: From OGP preview to SMTP testing, how I built 7 verification features into a single Electron app.

data.text: When doing web development, there are so many things to check before deployment. Are the OGP tags correct? Will the emails send? Is the performance acceptable? I got tired of opening different tools every time.
So I figured — why not build an all-in-one tool? That's how DevCheck started.
I chose Electron because I wanted everything to run locally. No cloud dependency.

items: Electron + React + TypeScript — React for UI, TypeScript for type safety

data.text: The SMTP test server was the trickiest part. I used the Node.js smtp-server package, but getting real-time email display working through Electron's IPC between main and renderer processes took some creative engineering.
The solution: run the SMTP server in the main process and notify the renderer via IPC on each email received.
"All-in-one" tools are fun but scope management matters. I started with 10 features but trimmed down to 7. Shipping beats perfection.
